project.teaser: The aim of the project is to determine the most affected and threatened components from the point of view of the long-term operation (LTO) and describe the effect of the LTO on the material properties as well as develop a simulation tool able to predict the non-acceptable...
project.objective: The aim of the project is to determine the most affected and threatened components from the point of view of the long-term operation (LTO) and describe the effect of the LTO on the material properties as well as develop a simulation tool able to predict the non-acceptable state of the material. The project is specifically focused on the Water-Water Energetic Reactor (VVER), nevertheless, the approach is to maintain the easy transferability to other light water reactor technologies, as well. The outputs of the project will lead to the increase of operational safety at the extended lifetime due to the in-time prediction of the potential failure. The basic approach of the project is to combine the development of the simulation tools, experimental work (material analyses), in-service and/or non-destructive inspection techniques to develop the effective “early warning” tool for the assessment of the system integrity for the LTO of the current LWR with a specific focus on the VVER technology. The project's aim specifically focuses on the thermal aging and swelling of the loaded constructional materials. One of the most affected components from the LTO´s point of view are the heat exchanging tubes of steam generators (thermal ageing) and reactor internals (swelling). The experimental material was screened and selected with the main criteria: to support and validate the proposed methods in the most accurate way, and to be “on stock” and available at the expected start of the project, the latest. The experiments are planned to be performed at the available material with clear and well-described operational history as well as the material from the original batch in the “as-received” state to gain the most relevant and valuable information with high impact to the community.
project.title: DELISA-LTO: DEscription of the extended LIfetime and its influence on the SAfety operation and construction materials performance – Long Term Operation with no compromises in the safety
project.keywords: long-term operation, interdisciplinary synergy, non-destructive testing, thermal ageing, swelling

article.title: Safe long-term operation in light water reactors

result.teaser: As many reactors approach the end of their design lifetime, the global trend among nuclear power plant (NPP) operators is to extend plant operation beyond this limit. This requires detailed knowledge of the technical condition and material degradation, as well as credible...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: State of the art on Thermal Ageing Evaluation
result.description: The report will include the results of state of the art on Thermal Ageing Evaluation based on obtaining deep knowledge of thermal ageing effects based on testing results and analytical research and developing/modify thermal ageing predictive models for long-term operation of SSCs

result.title: Database of the available materials
result.description: Description and database of the available materials (SG tubes, primary pipes) from decommissioning NPPs or from material archives of the project partners.

result.title: Database of relevant publication to project DELISA-LTO published in the past
result.description: In frame of this delivery the database of relevant publications with connection to the DELISA-LTO subject (issued in past) will be collected.

result.title: Report on indications of selected V1 SG tubes
result.description: Detailed summarization of the indication on the selected SG tubes which were obtained from V1 NPP.

result.title: Report on applicability of ultrasonic measurement for the evaluation of phase changes caused by thermal ageing
result.description: The report will summarize test results from measurements of ultrasonic signal properties, such as speed and attenuation of the ultrasonic signal, etc., on samples before and after exposure to thermal aging. The output will be recommendations for measuring phase changes caused by thermal aging through selected ultrasonic characteristics as a part of In-Service Inspection Program.

result.title: "Questionnaire for survey of used guidelines, standards, codes and ""best practices"" connection to the relevant SScs"
result.description: The questionnaire should be agreed with all participants and should cover the following topics: Safety codes, standards, guidelines related to the available SSCs' relevant for swelling and thermal ageing during LTO expected for 60+ years, best practice recommendations for swelling and thermal ageing assessment and relevant literature on swelling and thermal ageing of SSCs'.

result.description: The report will include the results of developing and testing the RPV internals models for swelling evaluation (created for different codes) and performing of the benchmark at simple level

result.title: Report on normative approaches, current practice and experience of RPV internals calculations (swelling evaluation) for LTO justification
result.description: The report will include the results of the comparison of rules-making and practices concerning swelling evaluation and calculation of RPV internals for PWR type reactors. The experience and safety requirements in the project developer countries related to RPV internals swelling calculations and evaluation will be explored, collected and analyzed

result.title: Project presentation
result.description: The first project deliverable will be a project presentation that will contain an overview of the project (its objectives, work packages, consortium members, etc.). The presentation will be presented on the project kick-off meeting.

result.title: Report summarizing available relevant data from ongoing/past project and material databases
result.description: Deliverable is focused on the presentation of summarized relevant data, experience and test results from other scientific projects and materials databases (e.g. MatDB) utilized within the DELISA project. Deliverable will also descibe benefits of the established connection with ongoing projects dedicated to the experimental validation of NPP structural materials degradation (e.g. FRACTESUS, STRUMAT-LTO).

result.title: Critical analysis of the primary circuit components important to LTO safe operation of NPP VVER 440 and VVER 1000
result.description: Identification of the critical issues with the primary circuit components based on the operational experience with importance of LTO safe operation of NPP WWER 440 and WWER 1000 and description of the degradation mechanisms for selected components of the available materials.

result.title: Questionnaire for the survey of laboratory equipment, testing procedures and quality assurance systems
result.description: Questionnaire for the survey of laboratory equipment, testing procedures and quality assurance systems. Necessary for the participants information collection within the Task 4.1 Characterization of the relevant specimens and methods.

result.title: Methodology of mechanical testing for evaluation of thermal ageing processes
result.description: The aim of this task is to design methodology and experimental matrix in order to obtain the maximum amount of information from the available materials according to the existing standards and laboratory practice. To accomplish this goal, standard as well non-standard testing methods will be taken into account, such a subsized specimen tests and Small Punch Test. Sample preparation procedure and transport logistics is part of the task.The following actions will be undertaken:- description of experimental methodology for standard and/or non-standard testing (subsized specimen, SPT etc.) of mechanical property changes- description of the possibilities for the ILS- cutting plans and experimental matrix- material sample preparation and transports to all partners

result.title: Cutting plans and experimental matrix for structural evaluation
result.description: Cutting plans and experimental matrix - description of the experimental material which will be cut according to the cutting plan for specific methods into many samples, that will be delivered to individual contributors based on the preferences and need of each one.

result.title: Synergies in VVER reactor long-term operation and aging: A comprehensive review of CAMIVVER, DELISA-LTO, and EVEREST projects

details.authors: Mathieu Hursin, Yann Perin, Denis Verrier, Vladimir Slugen, Jana Simeg Veternikova
